Detailed Description

Contains static utility functions.

bool Utility::closeZipCodes (  const char *  zc1,
const char *  zc2,
uint32  zipCodeDiff,
int32  high,
int32  low
)  [static]
 

Checks whether the zipcodes are close.

Parameters:
zc1 zipcode 1.
zc2 zipcode 2.
zipCodeDiff The tolerated difference.
high The highest single digit of a zipcode.
low The lowest single digit of a zipcode.
Returns:
True if the difference is within the tolerance.

int Utility::directory (  const char *  path,
char ***  entries
)  [static]
 

Puts the names of the files in path.

Will also list dirs.

Parameters:
path The path to look for files in.
entries The names of the directory entries will be put here. Must be deleted by the caller.
Returns:
Number of directory entries.

bool Utility::genCloseZipCodes (  const char *  zc1,
const char *  zc2,
uint32  zipCodeDiff
)  [static]
 

General method to check whether two zipcodes are close.

NB This method is more general than the closeZipCodes(), since it does not require the zipCode strings to be of equal length and it allows any alphanumeric character (not only numerical).

Parameters:
zc1 zipcode 1.
zc2 zipcode 2.
zipCodeDiff The tolerated difference.
Returns:
True if the difference is within the tolerance.

StringCode Utility::getCompass (  int  degree,
int  res
)  [static]
 

Get the compass (e.g North or East) of a given angle.

The angle must be in degrees, calculated clockwise from the north direction.

Parameters:
degree The direction in degrees.
res The letter resolution from 1-3.
Returns:
The compass degree direction in N, NW etc.

Returns:
The municipal part of the location. This is the same as the itemID for the municipal!

bool Utility::getNextToken (  istream &  is,
char *  str,
int  maxLength,
const char  delimiter = '\t'
)  [static]
 

Get the next token from a asci-file.

Lines with #, ! or as the first non-space character are skiped. Whitespaces at the end of a token are also skiped. If a token are longer than maxLength it is truncated.

Parameters:
is The file to read from.
str The preallocated buffer where the token is stored.
maxLength The maximum number of bytes to store in str.
delimiter The character that delimits the tokens (except from
or ).
Returns:
True if the token is stored in str, false otherwise.

int Utility::getParameterInt (  int  argc,
char *  argv[],
const char *  param,
int &  val,
int  startCheckingPos = 0
)  [static]
 

Get the integer value of a specified parameter.

Parameters:
argc The number of arguments in argv.
argv Vector with the given parameters.
param The parameter the caller is interested in.
val Outparameter that is set to the value of param. If a value less than 0 is returned then this value is not changed.
startCheckingPos Start checking this parameter (in order). This parameter is optional, default value is 0.
Returns:
The index of the param, -1 is returned of not present.

int Utility::getParameterStr (  int  argc,
char *  argv[],
const char *  param,
char *  result,
int  maxNbrChars = MAX_UINT32,
int  startCheckingPos = 0
)  [static]
 

Get the string value of a specified parameter.

If maxNbrCharachters > 1, then the result will always be NULL-terminated.

Parameters:
argc The number of arguments in argv.
argv Vector with the given parameters.
param The parameter the caller is interested in.
result Outparameter that is set to the value of param. If a value less than 0 is returned then this value is not changed.
maxNbrChars The maximum number of characters that is copied into the result. This parameter isoptional, default value is MAX_UINT32.
startCheckingPos Start checking this parameter (in order). This parameter is optional, default value is 0.
Returns:
The index of the param, -1 is returned of not present.

void Utility::getRoutingCost (  uint8 &  dist,
uint8 &  time,
uint8  percent
)  [static]
 

Returns the cost for walking at a certain speed in s/cm normalized to 1 byte.

Implements a table defined in the design document.

Parameters:
dist is the dist cost.
time is the time cost.
percent is the percent that the dist should be used and (100-percent) of time should be used.

char* Utility::getString (  const char *  inBuf,
char  startChar,
char  endChar,
char *  outBuf,
int  outBufSize
)  [static]
 

Get a string from a stringbuffer.

Parameters:
inBuf The buffer to look in.
startChar The start delimiter. If == '' then the returned string starts at the begining of inBuf.
endChar The end delimiter. If == '' the end of string will be the end delimiter.
outBuf The buffer to put the result into.
outBufSize The maximum number of chars to put in outBuf
Returns:
The length of the string put in outBuf. NULL if startChar || endChar wasn't found.

uint8 Utility::getWalkRoutingCost (  uint8  speed,
uint32  measureType
)  [static]
 

Returns the cost for walking at a certain speed in s/cm normalized to 1 byte.

Implements a table defined in the design document.

Parameters:
speed is the speed in km/h or mph.
tells if the speed is in km/h or mph.
Returns:
the cost.

uint16 Utility::hash (  const char *  key  )  [static]
 

Hashing function described in ``Fast Hashing of Variable-Length Text Strings'', by Peter K Pearson, CACM, June 1990.

Note that the returned hashcode must be modded with the bucket cardinal of the hashtable. The bucket cardinal should be a prime for best performance.

Parameters:
key NULL terminated key to hash
Returns:
Hashcode for the given key

Referenced by Property::Property().

byte *  data,

const char *  leadingString = NULL
)  [static]
 

Dump the buffer as hex.

Parameters:

data The data to print as hex
dataLength The length of the data
leadingString String to start each line of output with.

bool Utility::read (  int  fd,
void *  buf,
uint32  count
)  [static]
 

Secure file read routine.

The method reads count bytes from the file pointed to by fd and places the data in buf.

Deprecated:
Parameters:
fd filedescriptor
buf result buffer
count requested number of bytes
Returns:
true on success, false on failure

bool Utility::read (  ifstream &  ifs,
void *  buf,
uint32  count
)  [static]
 

Secure file read routine.

The method reads count bytes from the file given by ifs and places the data in buf.

Parameters:
ifs input file stream
buf result buffer
count requested number of bytes
Returns:
true on success, false on failure

int Utility::readLine (  FILE *  file,
char *  outBuf,
int  bufLen,
const char *  endChars
)  [static]
 

Reads characters from a stream until endline occurs.

The endChars are then removed from the string if the string ends with them.

Parameters:
file The stream to read from.
outBuf The buffer to put the result into.
bufLen The maximum number of characters to read.
endChars A string of characters that should be removed if they are at the end of the string.
Returns:
The number of bytes read.

const char *  zc2,
char  low,
char  high
)  [static]
 

Calculates the distance between two zipcode strings.

Parameters:
zc1 zipcode 1.
zc2 zipcode 2.
low The lowest character occuring in a zipcode.
high The highest character occuring in a zipcode.
Returns:
The distance.
